metadata.title: CVE-2020-6514 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Inappropriate implementation in WebRTC in Google Chrome prior to84.0.4147.89 allowed an attacker in a privileged network position topotentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted SCTP stream.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6514` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 80.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 80.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 80.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '80.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1').
